speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Suppose that you are handing someone some money to pay for a purchase. What word would you use to accompany the gesture of handing the money to him?

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous avez un franc, Monsieur?
narrator_cue: Ask, "Do you have one franc, sir?"

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: Now ask, "Do you want one franc?"

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Here's how to say, "I have no dollars."

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Mais je n'ai pas de dollars.

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Tell me you have some dollars.

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Ask me to give you some dollars.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous avez des francs?
narrator_cue: Ask her if she has some francs.

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Et j'ai aussi beaucoup de francs.
narrator_cue: Say, "And I also have a lot of francs."

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Ask her how many francs she has.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je voudrais acheter de la bière.
narrator_cue: Say, "I would like to buy some beer."

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: How does she say, "Here's a beer"?

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Say, "I would like to buy some wine."

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous avez des dollars?
narrator_cue: Ask me if I have any dollars.

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Non, je n'ai pas de dollars.

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Now let's review how to ask for directions. Say, "excuse me, ma'am."

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous savez où est le boulevard?
narrator_cue: "Do you know where the boulevard is?"

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: An American woman is talking to her husband. They are in France. How does she say, "I would like to buy something."

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Non, donnez-moi dix-sept ou dix-huit dollars.
narrator_cue: Say, "No, give me seventeen or eighteen dollars."

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous avez des francs?
narrator_cue: How does she ask him if he has any francs?

speaker: Male Speaker
text: J'ai beaucoup de dollars, mais pas de francs.
narrator_cue: How does she tell him that she has a lot of dollars, but no francs.

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Ask her how many francs she wants?

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: He wants to say, "I'm giving you ten dollars. Remembering that "you give" is "vous donnez" try to figure out how to say, "I give."

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Now try to say, "I give you."

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Mais je n'ai pas de francs.

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: Ask, "What are you going to do?"

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Alors, je vais acheter des francs.
narrator_cue: Say, "Well then I'm going to buy some francs."

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Donnez-moi des dollars, s'il vous plaît.

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: How did she say, "That's a lot"?

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: How did she say, "No, it's not a lot"?

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: She says here, "it's not a lot."

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: She says, "But in my place", meaning in America, "it's a lot."
